content.raw:
Other minor problems I noticed (which may or may not matter):

* If I move the habitat around, the door doesn't move with it.
* If I move the habitat around, the table (with the tools) stay fixed in place.  Indeed, physics doesn't seem to apply at all to the table, as running the simulation from that point doesn't make it fall to the ground.  Should we apply gravity to the table, and/or attach it to the habitat?
* The valve on the door doesn't seems to have a low amount of friction.  If I apply a lot of torque to it, it spins all the way to its "stop", and then starts spinning back the other way.  The valves for the satellite dish are similar.

Other minor problems I noticed (which may or may not matter):

  • If I move the habitat around, the door doesn't move with it.
  • If I move the habitat around, the table (with the tools) stay fixed in place. Indeed, physics doesn't seem to apply at all to the table, as running the simulation from that point doesn't make it fall to the ground. Should we apply gravity to the table, and/or attach it to the habitat?
  • The valve on the door doesn't seems to have a low amount of friction. If I apply a lot of torque to it, it spins all the way to its "stop", and then starts spinning back the other way. The valves for the satellite dish are similar.
